meanings.definition: Having many spikes or sharp points.
meanings.sent1: The cactus in the desert was the spikiest plant around.
meanings.sent2: The porcupine's back was the spikiest part of its body.
meanings.sent3: Be careful not to touch the spikiest part of the hedgehog!
meanings.sent4: Her words were like the spikiest thorns, piercing through his heart.
meanings.sent5: The spikiest fence in the garden kept the rabbits away.

meanings.sent1: The chef used the spikiest knife to chop the vegetables.
meanings.sent2: The spikiest rock on the mountain could easily cut through skin.
meanings.sent3: His wit was the spikiest tool in his arsenal of humor.
meanings.sent4: The spikiest icicle hung dangerously from the roof.
meanings.sent5: The spikiest thorn on the rose bush pricked her finger.

meanings.definition: Most likely to cause offense or irritation.
meanings.sent1: Her spikiest comments always left others feeling hurt.
meanings.sent2: The comedian's spikiest jokes were often misunderstood.
meanings.sent3: His spikiest remarks unintentionally sparked a heated debate.
meanings.sent4: The spikiest criticism came from those who knew her best.
meanings.sent5: The spikiest feedback on her work made her strive for improvement.
